intro: Phillyrea barceloi subsp. flahaultiana, commonly known as the Canary Island Phillyrea, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Oleaceae and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing a high degree of adaptability to arid conditions. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
